message.content: A Verbena lasiostachys is a species of perennial flowering plant in the vervain family. It is commonly referred to as Western Vervain or Skeleton Vervain. The plant can grow between 1-4 feet tall and has narrow, lance-shaped leaves with serrated edges. Its flowers are small and tubular with lavender to purplish-blue coloring. The inflorescence of the plant is a spike-like arrangement of numerous flowers. Verbena lasiostachys can be found in a variety of habitats including meadows, streambanks, and prairies, throughout western North America. The plant has been used in traditional medicine to treat a variety of ailments including coughs, fevers, and headaches. Verbena lasiostachys is also popular in landscaping due to its vibrant flowers and attractive foliage.
